snippet: The Commerce Department said that consumer spending increased just 0.3 percent in March after a 0.9 percent gain in February.
abstract: Commerce Department says consumer spending increased just 0.3 percent in March after a 0.9 percent gain in February; personal income grew 0.4 percent following a 0.3 percent gain in February.
lead_paragraph: The Commerce Department said that consumer spending increased just 0.3 percent in March after a 0.9 percent gain in February.

headline.seo: Consumer Spending Rose Slowly in March
headline.main: Consumer Spending Rose at a Slower Pace in March
headline.print_headline: Consumer Spending Rose At a Slower Pace in March
